Directions: Read this poem about a special day at school when an author visits. Then answer the questions. Some questions may ask you about certain lines. The lines are numbered on the left side.
Title: My Special Day at Third Street School
Author: by Eve Bunting
Content: AN AUTHOR’S COMING TO OUR SCHOOL.
The author wrote and said that she
Her name is Miss Amanda Drake.
First, of course, we read her books . . .
that we hang up in the hall.
We pile them in a basket
with a note that says “For You.”
We make a list of questions
She’s here! She’s here! We’re in a state
We stamp our feet and clap our hands
Amanda Drake is tall and thin.
Her hair is streaked with pink.
but it’s nicer than you think.
She talks to us and reads to us
and says she loves to write.
for words that I can’t spell.
“There’s something that I’d like to share
if you are loving what you do.”
